column4: what does it mean when they tell you there are security updates for Ubuntu Linux?..... I thought Linux was secure?!?
it is.. they are updates.. its hardly future proof
: well it makes it sound like Linux has security issues like Windows does
I read this whole article where some guy is mocking Linux for having "Security Updates" just like windows..... and I was nerved by it..... so I thought I would find out what thats all about...
its a good thing, worry when there are no updates
does it mean though that Linux is vulnerable to outside attack .... or that viruses are being made for Linux?
things can always be better nothing is infallible
as far as security goes linux is the best
I just wish they would name it something diferent so Windows users could not poke fun at Linux so easily
what are you using it for
hardly poking fun and those people are the trolls
I use it on all my PC's
updates are a great thing... technology moves fast and linux keeps state-of-the-art as apposed to windows updates being the second tuesday of every month which they dont really fix anything
they add restrictions like wga and drm.. which hamper a user rather than benefit them
